intro: Alsophila mapahuwensis, commonly known as the Mapahuwé tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the humid lowland forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant exhibits a slow growth rate, with the trunk forming a woody structure covered in a fibrous sheath. Its fronds are typically dark green and can reach lengths of up to 3 meters, contributing to its ornamental value. Alsophila mapahuwensis plays a role in the ecological structure of its habitat, providing shelter and food for various forest organisms.
